For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number Œ¥, the set {x : E | ‚à•x‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥ ‚à® x ‚àà s} equals the set {x : E | ‚à•x - o ‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥}, where o is the origin of E.

type: ‚àÄ {E : Type u_1} [inst : SeminormedAddCommGroup E] (Œ¥ : ‚Ñù) (s : Set E), Metric.ball 0 Œ¥ + s = Metric.thickening Œ¥ s
name: ball_add_zero
docString: For any seminormed additive commutative group E, subset s, and real number Œ¥, the set {x : E | ‚à•x‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥ ‚à® x ‚àà s} equals the set {x : E | ‚à•x - o ‚à• ‚â§ Œ¥}, where o is the origin of E.

The theorem `Int.gcd_dvd_left` states that for any two integers `a` and `b`, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `a` and `b` divides `a`. This is written in the Lean theorem prover as `‚Üë(Int.gcd a b) ‚à£ a`, where `Int.gcd a b` computes the gcd of `a` and `b`, the `‚Üë` operator converts that gcd from a natural number to an integer, and `‚à£` represents the "divides" relation. In mathematical terms, if $gcd(a, b) = d$, then $d | a$.

type: ‚àÄ {a b : ‚Ñ§}, ‚Üë(a.gcd b) ‚à£ a
name: Int.gcd_dvd_left
docString: The theorem `Int.gcd_dvd_left` states that for any two integers `a` and `b`, the greatest common divisor (gcd) of `a` and `b` divides `a`. This is written in the Lean theorem prover as `‚Üë(Int.gcd a b) ‚à£ a`, where `Int.gcd a b` computes the gcd of `a` and `b`, the `‚Üë` operator converts that gcd from a natural number to an integer, and `‚à£` represents the "divides" relation. In mathematical terms, if $gcd(a, b) = d$, then $d | a$.

For a continuous function `f` on `[0,1]`, given `Œµ > 0`, `n > 0`, `x ‚àà [0,1]`, `k ‚àà [0,1]` not in `S` where `S = {k/n | k ‚àà ‚Ñï, |k/n - x| < Œ¥}`, and `Œ¥` is the modulus of continuity for `f` such that `|f(x) - f(y)| < Œµ/2` for `|x - y| < Œ¥`, the inequality `1 ‚â§ Œ¥¬≤ * (x - k/n)¬≤` holds.

type:
‚àÄ {f : C(‚ÜëunitInterval, ‚Ñù)} {Œµ : ‚Ñù} {h : 0 < Œµ} {n : ‚Ñï} {x : ‚ÜëunitInterval} {k : Fin (n + 1)},
  k ‚àà (bernsteinApproximation.S f Œµ h n x)·∂ú ‚Üí 1 ‚â§ bernsteinApproximation.Œ¥ f Œµ h ^ (-2) * (‚Üëx - ‚Üë(bernstein.z k)) ^ 2
name: bernsteinApproximation.le_of_mem_S_compl
docString: For a continuous function `f` on `[0,1]`, given `Œµ > 0`, `n > 0`, `x ‚àà [0,1]`, `k ‚àà [0,1]` not in `S` where `S = {k/n | k ‚àà ‚Ñï, |k/n - x| < Œ¥}`, and `Œ¥` is the modulus of continuity for `f` such that `|f(x) - f(y)| < Œµ/2` for `|x - y| < Œ¥`, the inequality `1 ‚â§ Œ¥¬≤ * (x - k/n)¬≤` holds.

This theorem states that for any type `Œ±` that is a cancel commutative monoid with zero and also a Greatest Common Divisor (gcd) monoid, and for any elements `a`, `b`, `c`, and `d` of `Œ±`, if `a` divides `b` and `c` divides `d`, then the gcd of `a` and `c` divides the gcd of `b` and `d`. Here, "divides" means that there exists another element of `Œ±` such that multiplying that element by the divisor yields the dividend.

type:
‚àÄ {Œ± : Type u_1} [inst : CancelCommMonoidWithZero Œ±] [inst_1 : GCDMonoid Œ±] {a b c d : Œ±},
  a ‚à£ b ‚Üí c ‚à£ d ‚Üí gcd a c ‚à£ gcd b d
name: gcd_dvd_gcd
docString: This theorem states that for any type `Œ±` that is a cancel commutative monoid with zero and also a Greatest Common Divisor (gcd) monoid, and for any elements `a`, `b`, `c`, and `d` of `Œ±`, if `a` divides `b` and `c` divides `d`, then the gcd of `a` and `c` divides the gcd of `b` and `d`. Here, "divides" means that there exists another element of `Œ±` such that multiplying that element by the divisor yields the dividend.

If a differentiable function `f` is approximated by a linear map `A` on a set `s`, up to `Œ¥`,
then at almost every `x` in `s` one has `‚Äñf' x - A‚Äñ ‚â§ Œ¥`.

      ‚àÄ (f' : E ‚Üí E ‚ÜíL[‚Ñù] E),
        (‚àÄ x ‚àà s, HasFDerivWithinAt f (f' x) s x) ‚Üí ‚àÄ·µê (x : E) ‚àÇMeasureTheory.Measure.restrict Œº s, ‚Äñf' x - A‚Äñ‚Çä ‚â§ Œ¥
name: ApproximatesLinearOn.norm_fderiv_sub_le
docString:
